info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 3:38PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Mecklenburg, southeastern Gaston and northeastern York Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 338 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Gastonia, or near Steele Creek, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gastonia, Belmont, South Gastonia, Clover, Cramerton, Lowell, Ranlo, Mcadenville, Charlotte Douglas Airport and Steele Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
